error.signature: Error: Plan approval required. Terraform detected changes that require approval before applying.
error.regex: (?i)(?:Plan.*changes|terraform plan.*diff|infrastructure changes detected|plan.*not empty|Resources to add|Resources to destroy)

verdict.summary: Terraform plan detected infrastructure changes that differ from the current state. In CI, this often blocks auto-apply pipelines. Caused by manual changes to infrastructure (drift), state file desync, or legitimate code changes requiring review.

dead_ends.action: Auto-applying terraform without reviewing the plan in production
dead_ends.why_fails: Unreviewed auto-apply can destroy or modify production resources. Destructive changes (replace, destroy) are especially dangerous without human review.

dead_ends.action: Ignoring plan diffs and merging without resolving drift
dead_ends.why_fails: Infrastructure drift compounds over time. Future plans become increasingly large and confusing, making it harder to determine which changes are intentional.

workarounds.action: Review the plan output and approve intentional changes
workarounds.how: Run terraform plan -out=plan.tfplan to save the plan. Review the output carefully. If changes are intentional, apply with terraform apply plan.tfplan. In CI, post the plan as a PR comment for team review before applying.

workarounds.action: Import or refresh state to resolve drift from manual changes
workarounds.how: If changes are due to manual modifications: terraform import <resource> <id> for new resources. terraform refresh to update state to match actual infrastructure. Use terraform state commands to reconcile.

leads_to.condition: when an applied plan causes issues and rollback is needed

preceded_by.condition: when missing cloud credentials cause terraform to detect unexpected state differences

frequently_confused_with.distinction: terraform-plan-diff is about infrastructure state differences; argocd-sync-failed is about Kubernetes manifest state differences. Both are state reconciliation issues in different domains.
